trans-unit.source: This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt (the user can still change the file name if they want). There are no restrictions on allowed values, though / and \ are converted to underscores. Most file systems limit some punctuation in file names, and browsers will adjust the suggested name accordingly.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指示浏览器下载URL而不是导航到URL，因此将提示用户将URL保存为本地文件。如果属性具有值，则将其用作“保存”提示中的预填充文件名（用户仍然可以根据需要更改文件名）。尽管 / 和 \ 转换为下划线，但对允许的值没有限制。大多数文件系统在文件名中都限制了一些标点符号，浏览器会相应地调整建议的名称。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is enumerated and not Boolean. A value of true or false is mandatory, and shorthand like <img draggable> is forbidden. The correct usage is <img draggable="false">.
This attribute is not inherited by the <bdi> element. If not set, its value is auto.
trans-unit.target: <bdi> 元素不继承此属性。如果未设置，则其值为 auto 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is also available on <input type="image"> and <button> elements.
This attribute is also available on <input type="image"> elements.
trans-unit.target: 此属性在 <input type="image"> 元素上也可用。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is also available on <input type="image"> and <input type="submit"> elements.
This attribute is also available on <input type="submit"> and <button> elements.
This attribute is also available on <input type="submit"> elements.
trans-unit.target: 此属性在 <input type="submit"> 元素上也可用。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is also used when copying and pasting the image to text, or saving a linked image to a bookmark.

This attribute is an enumerated one and not a Boolean one. This means that the explicit usage of one of the values true or false is mandatory and that a shorthand like <label draggable>Example Label</label> is not allowed. The correct usage is <label draggable="true">Example Label</label>.
trans-unit.target: 此属性是枚举属性，而不是布尔值。这意味着必须明确使用值 true 或 false 之一，并且不允许使用诸如 <label draggable>Example Label</label> 类的速记。正确的用法是 <label draggable="true">Example Label</label> 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is an enumerated one and not a Boolean one. This means that the explicit usage of one of the values true or false is mandatory and that a shorthand like <label spellcheck>Example Label</label> is not allowed. The correct usage is <label spellcheck="true">Example Label</label>.
trans-unit.target: 此属性是枚举属性，而不是布尔值。这意味着必须明确使用值 true 或 false 之一，并且不允许使用诸如 <label spellcheck>Example Label</label> 类的速记。正确的用法是 <label spellcheck="true">Example Label</label> 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is an enumerated one and not a Boolean one. This means that the explicit usage of one of the values true, false or the empty string is mandatory and that a shorthand like <label contenteditable>Example Label</label> is not allowed. The correct usage is <label contenteditable="true">Example Label</label>.
trans-unit.target: 此属性是枚举属性，而不是布尔值。这意味着必须明确使用值true，false或空字符串之一，并且不允许使用诸如 <label contenteditable>Example Label</label> 类的缩写。正确的用法是 <label contenteditable="true">Example Label</label> 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is considered a legacy attribute and redefined as allow="fullscreen".
trans-unit.target: 该属性被认为是旧属性，并重新定义为 allow="fullscreen" 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is considered a legacy attribute and redefined as allow="payment".
trans-unit.target: 该属性被认为是旧属性，并重新定义为 allow="payment" 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is mandatory for the <bdo> element where it has a different semantic meaning.
trans-unit.target: 对于具有不同语义含义的 <bdo> 元素，此属性是必需的。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is merely a hint for the browser: browsers are not required to be able to check for spelling errors. Typically non-editable elements are not checked for spelling errors, even if the spellcheck attribute is set to true and the browser supports spellchecking.
trans-unit.target: 该属性仅是浏览器的提示：浏览器不需要能够检查拼写错误。通常，即使将spellcheck属性设置为true且浏览器支持拼写检查，也不会检查不可编辑元素的拼写错误。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is merely a hint for the browser: browsers are not required to check for spelling errors. Typically non-editable elements are not checked for spelling errors, even if the spellcheck attribute is set to true and the browser supports spellchecking.

This attribute is not only obsolete, but was rarely implemented anyway. To achieve the same effect as the char attribute, set the CSS text-align property to the same string you would specify for the char property, such as text-align: ".".
trans-unit.target: 此属性不仅过时，而且无论如何很少实现。为了获得与 char 属性相同的效果，请将CSS text-align 属性设置为您为 char 属性指定的相同字符串，例如 text-align: "." 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is obsolete, and was never widely supported anyway.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性已经过时了,反正从来没有被广泛支持过。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is only used when rel="preload" has been set on the <link> element. It specifies the type of content being loaded by the <link>, which is necessary for content prioritization, request matching, application of correct content security policy, and setting of correct Accept request header.
trans-unit.target: 仅在 <link> 元素上设置 rel="preload" 时才使用此属性。它指定 <link> 加载的内容的类型，这对于内容优先级，请求匹配，正确的内容安全策略的应用以及正确的 Accept request标头的设置是必需的。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is only used when rel="preload" or rel="prefetch" has been set on the <link> element. It specifies the type of content being loaded by the <link>, which is necessary for request matching, application of correct content security policy, and setting of correct Accept request header. Furthermore, rel="preload" uses this as a signal for request prioritization. The table below lists the valid values for this attribute and the elements or resources they apply to.
This attribute is text for the label indicating the meaning of the option. If the label attribute isn't defined, its value is that of the element text content.
trans-unit.target: 此属性是标签的文本，指示选项的含义。如果未定义 label 属性，则其值为元素文本内容的值。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used for labeling frames. Without labeling, every link will open in the frame that it’s in – the closest parent frame. See the target attribute for more information.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于标记框架。如果不加标签，则每个链接都将在其所在的框架（最接近的父框架）中打开。有关更多信息，请参见 target 属性。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to define a recommended cell height.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于定义推荐的单元格高度。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to define a recommended cell height. Use the CSS height property instead.

This attribute is used to define a recommended cell width. Additional space can be added with the cellspacing and cellpadding properties and the width of the <col> element can also create extra width. But, if a column's width is too narrow to show a particular cell properly, it will be widened when displayed.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于定义建议的像元宽度。可以使用 cellspacing 和 cellpadding 属性添加额外的空间，并且 <col> 元素的宽度也可以创建额外的宽度。但是，如果列的宽度太窄而无法正确显示特定的单元格，则显示时它将变宽。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to define a recommended cell width. Additional space can be added with the cellspacing and cellpadding properties and the width of the <col> element can also create extra width. But, if a column's width is too narrow to show a particular cell properly, it will be widened when displayed.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于定义建议的像元宽度。可以使用cellpacing和cellpadding属性添加额外的空间，并且 <col> 元素的宽度也可以创建额外的宽度。但是，如果列的宽度太窄而无法正确显示特定的单元格，则显示时它将变宽。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to define a recommended cell width. Use the CSS width property instead.

This attribute is used to define the type of the content linked to. The value of the attribute should be a MIME type such as text/html, text/css, and so on. The common use of this attribute is to define the type of stylesheet being referenced (such as text/css), but given that CSS is the only stylesheet language used on the web, not only is it possible to omit the type attribute, but is actually now recommended practice. It is also used on rel="preload" link types, to make sure the browser only downloads file types that it supports.

This attribute is used to define the type of the content linked to. The value of the attribute should be a MIME type such as text/html, text/css, and so on. The common use of this attribute is to define the type of stylesheet being referenced (such as text/css), but given that CSS is the only stylesheet language used on the web, not only is it possible to omit the type attribute, but is actually now recommended practice. It is also used on rel="preload" link types, to make sure the browser only downloads file types that it supports.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于定义链接到的内容的类型。该属性的值应为MIME类型，例如text / html，text / css等。此属性的常用用法是定义所引用的样式表的类型（例如text / css），但是鉴于CSS是网络上使用的唯一样式表语言，不仅可以省略type属性，而且可以实际上现在建议练习。它还用于 rel="preload" 链接类型，以确保浏览器仅下载其支持的文件类型。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to disable a link relationship. In conjunction with scripting, this attribute could be used to turn on and off various style sheet relationships.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性用于禁用链接关系。结合脚本,这个属性可以用来开启和关闭各种样式表关系。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment character specified by the char attribute.
This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment character specified by the char attribute.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于指示从char属性指定的对齐字符偏移列数据的字符数。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
This attribute is used to indicate the number of characters to offset the column data from the alignment characters specified by the char attribute.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于指示从char属性指定的对齐字符偏移列数据的字符数。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to position the applet on the page relative to content that might flow around it. The HTML 4.01 specification defines values of bottom, left, middle, right, and top, whereas Microsoft and Netscape also might support absbottom, absmiddle, baseline, center, and texttop.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于相对于可能在其周围流动的内容在页面上放置小程序。HTML 4.01规范定义了 bottom ， left ， middle ， right 和 top 的值，而Microsoft和Netscape也可能支持 absbottom ， absmiddle ， baseline ， center 和 texttop 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于设置字符以对齐列中的单元格。尝试对齐数字或货币值时，其典型值包括句点（。）。如果 align 未设置为 char ，则忽略此属性。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于设置字符以对齐列中的单元格。尝试对齐数字或货币值时，其典型值包括句点（。）。如果 align 未设置为 char ，则忽略此属性。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于设置字符以对齐列中的单元格。尝试对齐数字或货币值时，其典型值包括句点（。）。如果 align 未设置为 char ，则忽略此属性。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于设置字符以对齐列中的单元格。尝试对齐数字或货币值时，其典型值包括句点（。）。如果 align 未设置为 char ，则忽略此属性。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to set the character to align the cells in a column on. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
This attribute is used to shift column data to the right of the character specified by the char attribute. Its value specifies the length of this shift.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于将列数据移至char属性指定的字符的右侧。其值指定此移位的长度。

trans-unit.source: This attribute is used to specify the name of the control.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于指定控件的名称。

trans-unit.source: This attribute lets you associate <button> elements to <form>s anywhere in the document, not just inside a <form>. It can also override an ancestor <form> element.
This attribute lets you associate <output> elements to <form>s anywhere in the document, not just inside a <form>. It can also override an ancestor <form> element.
This attribute lets you associate <select> elements to <form>s anywhere in the document, not just inside a <form>. It can also override an ancestor <form> element.

This attribute lets you specify the form element to which the select element is associated (that is, its "form owner"). If this attribute is specified, its value must be the same as the id of a form element in the same document. This enables you to place select elements anywhere within a document, not just as descendants of their form elements.
trans-unit.target: 此属性使您可以指定与select元素关联的form元素（即，其“ form owner”）。如果指定了此属性，则其值必须与同一文档中表单元素的 id 相同。这使您可以将选择元素放置在文档中的任何位置，而不仅仅是它们的表单元素的后代。

trans-unit.source: This attribute may also have a value taken from the extended list defined on WHATWG Wiki MetaExtensions page. Although none have been formally accepted yet, a few commonly used names are:
trans-unit.target: 此属性也可以具有从WHATWG Wiki MetaExtensions页面上定义的扩展列表中获取的值。尽管尚未正式接受任何名称，但一些常用名称是：

trans-unit.source: This attribute may be re-introduced in the future per https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/3547. If you want to use the attribute now, you can use a polyfill.
This attribute must not be used if the src attribute is absent (i.e. for inline scripts), in this case it would have no effect.
trans-unit.target: 如果不存在 src 属性（即，对于内联脚本），则不得使用此属性，在这种情况下，它将无效。

trans-unit.source: This attribute must not be used if the src attribute is absent (i.e. for inline scripts). If it is included in this case it will have no effect.
trans-unit.target: 如果不存在 src 属性（即，对于内联脚本），则不得使用此属性。如果在这种情况下将其包含在内，则将无效。

trans-unit.source: This attribute names a relationship of the linked document to the current document. The attribute must be a space-separated list of link type values.
This attribute names a relationship of the linked document to the current document. The attribute must be a space-separated list of the link types values.
trans-unit.target: 此属性命名链接文档与当前文档的关系。该属性必须是链接类型values的以空格分隔的列表。

trans-unit.source: This attribute on a <button> is nonstandard and Firefox-specific. Unlike other browsers, Firefox persists the dynamic disabled state of a <button> across page loads. Setting autocomplete="off" on the button disables this feature; see bug 654072.
This attribute only works for same-origin URLs.
trans-unit.target: 此属性仅适用于同源URL。

trans-unit.source: This attribute prevents resizing of frames by users.
trans-unit.target: 此属性可防止用户调整帧的大小。

trans-unit.source: This attribute refers to an archived or compressed version of the applet and its associated class files, which might help reduce download time.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指的是小程序及其相关类文件的存档或压缩版本,这可能有助于减少下载时间。

trans-unit.source: This attribute sets the bullet style for the list. The values defined under HTML3.2 and the transitional version of HTML 4.0/4.01 are:
This attribute sets the text color using either a named color or a color specified in the hexadecimal #RRGGBB format.
trans-unit.target: 此属性使用命名的颜色或以十六进制#RRGGBB格式指定的颜色来设置文本颜色。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specified a reverse link, the inverse relationship of the rel attribute. It was deprecated for being very confusing.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定了反向链接，即rel属性的逆关系。不建议使用它，因为它非常令人困惑。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies alternative style sheet sets.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定替代样式表集。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies a default width for each column in the current column group. In addition to the standard pixel and percentage values, this attribute might take the special form 0*, which means that the width of each column in the group should be the minimum width necessary to hold the column's contents. Relative widths such as 0.5* also can be used.
trans-unit.target: 此属性为当前列组中的每个列指定默认宽度。除了标准的像素和百分比值之外，此属性还可以采用特殊形式 0* ，这意味着组中每一列的宽度应为容纳该列内容所需的最小宽度。也可以使用相对宽度，例如 0.5* 。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies a default width for each column in the current column group. In addition to the standard pixel and percentage values, this attribute might take the special form 0*, which means that the width of each column in the group should be the minimum width necessary to hold the column's contents. Relative widths such as 5* also can be used.
This attribute specifies additional horizontal space, in pixels, to be reserved on either side of the applet.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了小程序两边要保留的额外水平空间,单位为像素。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies additional vertical space, in pixels, to be reserved above and below the applet.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定了小程序上下保留的额外垂直空间,单位为像素。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies how a text is vertically aligned inside a cell. Possible values for this attribute are:
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了单元格内文本的垂直排列方式。这个属性的可能值是:

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies how much of the task that has been completed. It must be a valid floating point number between 0 and max, or between 0 and 1 if max is omitted. If there is no value attribute, the progress bar is indeterminate; this indicates that an activity is ongoing with no indication of how long it is expected to take.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定已完成的任务量。它必须介于0和一个有效的浮点数 max ，或0和1之间，如果 max 被省略。如果没有 value 属性，则进度条不确定。这表明活动正在进行中，没有指示预计需要多长时间。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies how much of the task that has been completed. It must be a valid floating point number between 0 and max, or between 0 and 1 if max is omitted. If there is no value attribute, the progress bar is indeterminate; this indicates that an activity is ongoing with no indication of how long it is expected to take.
This attribute specifies in pixels the width that the applet needs.
trans-unit.target: 该属性以像素为单位指定小程序所需的宽度。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies that the styles only apply to the elements of its parent(s) and children.
trans-unit.target: 该属性指定样式只适用于其父元素和子元素。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定用户在提交表单前必须填写一个值。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the URL of the linked resource. A URL can be absolute or relative.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定链接资源的URL。URL可以是绝对的或相对的。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the URL of a serialized representation of an applet.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了小程序的序列化表示的URL。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the URL of the applet's class file to be loaded and executed. Applet filenames are identified by a .class filename extension. The URL specified by code might be relative to the codebase attribute.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定要加载和执行的applet的类文件的URL。Applet文件名由.class文件扩展名标识。由代码指定的URL可能是相对于 codebase 属性的。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the URL of the sound file to be played, which must be one of the following types: .wav, .au, or .mid.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了要播放的声音文件的URL,它必须是以下类型之一:.wav、.au或.mid。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the alignment of the content in a column group to a character. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored, though it will still be used as the default value for the align of the <col> which are members of this column group.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定列组中的内容与字符的对齐方式。尝试对齐数字或货币值时，其典型值包括句点（。）。如果 align 未设置为 char ，该属性将被忽略，但它仍然会被用作默认值的 align 的 <col> 其是该列组的成员。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the alignment of the content in a column to a character. Typical values for this include a period (.) when attempting to align numbers or monetary values. If align is not set to char, this attribute is ignored.
This attribute specifies the document that will be displayed by the frame.
trans-unit.target: 该属性指定了框架将显示的文件。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the font size as either a numeric or relative value. Numeric values range from 1 to 7 with 1 being the smallest and 3 the default.
trans-unit.target: 此属性以数值或相对值的形式指定字体大小。数字值的范围是1到7,1是最小的,3是默认值。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the font size as either a numeric or relative value. Numeric values range from 1 to 7 with 1 being the smallest and 3 the default. It can be defined using a relative value, like +2 or -3, which set it relative to the value of the size attribute of the <basefont> element, or relative to 3, the default value, if none does exist.
trans-unit.target: 此属性将字体大小指定为数字值或相对值。数值范围为 1 到 7 ,其中 1 为最小值，默认值为 3 。可以使用相对值来定义它，例如 +2 或 -3 ，将其相对于 <basefont> 元素的 size 属性值设置，或者相对于默认值 3 进行设置（如果不存在）。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the height, in pixels, that the applet needs.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了小程序需要的高度,单位为像素。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the machine-readable translation of the content of the element.
trans-unit.target: 这个属性指定了元素内容的机器可读翻译。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the media that the linked resource applies to. Its value must be a media type / media query. This attribute is mainly useful when linking to external stylesheets — it allows the user agent to pick the best adapted one for the device it runs on.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定链接资源适用的媒体。它的值必须是媒体类型/ 媒体查询。当链接到外部样式表时，此属性主要有用-它允许用户代理为其运行的设备选择最适合的设备。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the name of a group of commands to be toggled as radio buttons when selected. May only be used where the type attribute is radio.
trans-unit.target: 此属性指定选定时要切换为单选按钮的一组命令的名称。只能在 type 属性是 radio 的情况下使用。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the number and size of horizontal spaces in a frameset.
trans-unit.target: 该属性指定帧集中水平空格的数量和大小。

trans-unit.source: This attribute specifies the number and size of vertical spaces in a frameset.
trans-unit.target: 该属性指定帧集中垂直空间的数量和大小。

trans-unit.source: This attribute was used to define a region for hyperlinks to create an image map. The values are circle, default, polygon, and rect. The format of the coords attribute depends on the value of shape. For circle, the value is x,y,r where x and y are the pixel coordinates for the center of the circle and r is the radius value in pixels. For rect, the coords attribute should be x,y,w,h. The x,y values define the upper-left-hand corner of the rectangle, while w and h define the width and height respectively. A value of polygon for shape requires x1,y1,x2,y2,... values for coords. Each of the x,y pairs defines a point in the polygon, with successive points being joined by straight lines and the last point joined to the first. The value default for shape requires that the entire enclosed area, typically an image, be used.
trans-unit.target: 此属性用于定义超链接的区域以创建图像映射。值是 circle ， default ， polygon 和 rect 。coords属性的格式取决于shape的值。对于 circle ，值是 x,y,r ，其中 x 和 y 是圆心的像素坐标， r 是以像素为单位的半径值。对于 rect ，coords属性应为 x,y,w,h 。的 x,y 值定义了矩形的上左角，而 w 和 h 分别定义宽度和高度。的价值 polygon 的形状要求 x1,y1,x2,y2,... 值COORDS。每个 x,y 对在多边形中定义一个点，连续的点通过直线连接，最后的点与第一个连接。形状的 default 值要求使用整个封闭区域，通常是图像。

trans-unit.source: This attribute's value is an opaque string: this means that web authors should not rely on it to convey human-readable information (although having your IDs somewhat human-readable can be useful for code comprehension, e.g. consider ticket-18659 versus r45tgfe-freds&$@).

This attribute's value must not contain whitespace (spaces, tabs etc.). Browsers treat non-conforming IDs that contain whitespace as if the whitespace is part of the ID. In contrast to the class attribute, which allows space-separated values, elements can only have one single ID.
trans-unit.target: 此属性的值不得包含空格（空格，制表符等）。浏览器将包含空格的不合格ID视为空白是​​ID的一部分。与允许使用空格分隔值的class属性相反，元素只能具有一个ID。

This example builds on the last one, offering three different sources for the media; this allows the video to be watched regardless of which video codecs are supported by the browser.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子建立在上一个例子的基础上,为媒体提供了三个不同的来源;这使得无论浏览器支持哪种视频编解码器,都可以观看视频。

trans-unit.source: This example builds upon the previous one, showing how to turn the image into a link. It is very simple to do so — you just nest the <img> tag inside the <a>. One consideration is that you should made the alternative text describe the resource the link is pointing to.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子建立在前一个例子的基础上，展示了如何将图像变成链接。这样做非常简单-您只需将 <img> 标记嵌套在 <a> 内。一个考虑因素是，您应该使替代文本描述链接指向的资源。

trans-unit.source: This example builds upon the previous one, showing how to turn the image into a link. To do so, nest the <img> tag inside the <a>. You should made the alternative text describe the resource the link is pointing to, as if you were using a text link instead.
This example creates a shadowed box by applying a style to the <div> using CSS. Note the use of the class attribute on the <div> to apply the style named "shadowbox" to the element.
trans-unit.target: 本示例通过使用CSS 将样式应用于 <div> 来创建阴影框。注意在 <div> 上使用 class 属性将名为 "shadowbox" 的样式应用于元素。

trans-unit.source: This example defines a two-line title.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子定义了一个两行标题。

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates how to offer a video in Ogg format for users whose browsers support Ogg format, and a QuickTime format video for users whose browsers support that. If the audio or video element is not supported by the browser, a notice is displayed instead. If the browser supports the element but does not support any of the specified formats, an error event is raised and the default media controls (if enabled) will indicate an error. Be sure to reference our guide to media types and formats on the web for details on what media file formats you can use and how well they're supported by browsers.

This example demonstrates how to offer a video in Ogg format for users whose browsers support Ogg format, and a QuickTime format video for users whose browsers support that. If the audio or video element is not supported by the browser, a notice is displayed instead. If the browser supports the element but does not support any of the specified formats, an error event is raised and the default media controls (if enabled) will indicate an error. See also the list of media formats supported by the audio and video elements in various browsers.
trans-unit.target: 本示例演示如何为浏览器支持Ogg格式的用户提供Ogg格式的视频，以及为浏览器支持Ogg格式的用户提供QuickTime格式的视频。如果浏览器不支持 audio 或 video 元素，则会显示一条通知。如果浏览器支持该元素但不支持任何指定的格式，则会引发 error 事件，并且默认媒体控件（如果启用）将指示错误。另请参阅各种浏览器中音频和视频元素支持的媒体格式列表。

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates the use of <address> to demarcate the contact information for an article's author.
trans-unit.target: 本示例演示了如何使用 <address> 为文章作者划分联系信息。

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates the use of the <blockquote> element to quote a passage from RFC 1149,
trans-unit.target: 此示例演示了 <blockquote> 元素如何引用RFC 1149中的段落，

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates using <mark> to mark search results within a passage.
trans-unit.target: 本示例演示了使用 <mark> 标记段落中的搜索结果。

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates using the <i> element to mark text that is in another language.
trans-unit.target: 本示例演示使用 <i> 元素标记另一种语言的文本。

trans-unit.source: This example establishes a page whose title (as displayed at the top of the window or in the window's tab) as "Awesome interesting stuff".
This example has a minimum and maximum number of characters — of 10 and 20 respectively. Try it and see.
trans-unit.target: 此示例的最小和最大字符数分别为10和20。试试看。

trans-unit.source: This example has a placeholder set. Notice how it disappears when you start typing into the box.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子设置了一个占位符。请注意,当你开始在框中输入时,它是如何消失的。

trans-unit.source: This example includes multiple <source> elements. The browser tries to load the first source element (Opus) if it is able to play it; if not it falls back to the second (Vorbis) and finally back to MP3:
trans-unit.target: 此示例包括多个 <source> 元素。如果能够播放，则浏览器将尝试加载第一个源元素（Opus）。如果不是，它会回到第二个（Vorbis），最后回到MP3：

trans-unit.source: This example is the same as the previous one, but all the properties are separated from their items
trans-unit.target: 这个例子和前一个一样,但是所有的属性都是和它们的项目分开的

trans-unit.source: This example lets the user select any value between 0 and π without any restriction on the fractional part of the value selected.
trans-unit.target: 该示例使用户可以选择0到π之间的任何值，而对所选值的小数部分没有任何限制。

trans-unit.source: This example lists the winners of a competition using <span> elements only, and one of the winners has a name consisting of RTL text. In this case the "- 1", which consists of characters with neutral or weak directionality, will adopt the directionality of the RTL text, and the result will be garbled:
This example lists the winners of a competition using <span> elements only. When the names only contain LTR text the results look fine:

This example lists the winners of a competition using <bdi> elements. These elements instruct the browser to treat the name in isolation from its embedding context, so the example output is properly ordered:

This example only accepts input which matches the format for a valid United States Social Security Number. These numbers, used for tax and identification purposes in the US, are in the form "123-45-6789". Assorted rules for what values are permitted in each group exist as well.
trans-unit.target: 本示例仅接受与有效的美国社会保险号格式匹配的输入。这些数字在美国用于税收和识别目的，格式为“ 123-45-6789”。还存在关于每个组中允许哪些值的各种规则。

trans-unit.source: This example opens a pop-up dialog box containing a form when the "Update details" button is clicked.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子在点击 "更新详情 "按钮时,会打开一个包含表单的弹出式对话框。

trans-unit.source: This example opens a pop-up dialog box that contains a form, when the "Update details" button is clicked.
This example plays a video when activated, providing the user with the browser's default video controls to control playback.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子在激活时播放视频,为用户提供浏览器默认的视频控件来控制播放。

trans-unit.source: This example shows a <details> element with no provided summary.
trans-unit.target: 本示例显示了一个 <details> 元素，但未提供摘要。

trans-unit.source: This example shows a disabled <fieldset> with two controls inside it. Note how both the controls are disabled due to being inside a disabled <fieldset>.
trans-unit.target: 本示例显示了一个禁用的 <fieldset> ,其中带有两个控件。请注意，由于处于禁用的 <fieldset> 中,如何同时禁用这两个控件。

trans-unit.source: This example shows a really simple <fieldset> example, with a <legend>, and a single control inside it.
trans-unit.target: 此示例显示了一个非常简单的 <fieldset> 示例，其中带有 <legend> ，并且内部有一个控件。

trans-unit.source: This example shows how you could use some CSS and JavaScript to provide extensive custom styling for a <select> box.

This example shows two <textarea>s — one of which is disabled, and one of which is readonly. Have a play with both and you'll see the difference in behavior — the disabled element is not selectable in any way (and its value is not submitted), whereas the readonly element is selectable and its contents copyable (and its value is submitted); you just can't edit the contents.
trans-unit.target: 此示例显示了两个 <textarea> ，其中一个被 disabled ，另一个是 readonly 。两者兼而有之，您会看到行为上的差异— disabled 元素无法以任何方式选择（并且其值未提交），而 readonly 元素是可选的并且其内容可复制（并且其值已提交） ; 您只是无法编辑内容。

trans-unit.source: This example simply uses a plain <dfn> element to identify the location of a term within the definition.
trans-unit.target: 本示例仅使用普通的 <dfn> 元素来标识术语在定义中的位置。

trans-unit.source: This example specifies which audio track to embed using the src attribute on a nested <source> element rather than directly on the <audio> element. It is always useful to include the file's MIME type inside the type attribute, as the browser is able to instantly tell if it can play that file, and not waste time on it if not.
trans-unit.target: 此示例使用嵌套的 <source> 元素而不是直接在 <audio> 元素上使用 src 属性指定要嵌入的音频轨道。将文件的MIME类型包含在 type 属性中总是有用的，因为浏览器能够立即判断它是否可以播放该文件，并且如果不可以，则不会浪费时间。

trans-unit.source: This example uses <aside> to mark up a paragraph in an article. The paragraph is only indirectly related to the main article content:
This example uses <tt> to show text entered into, and output by, a terminal application.
trans-unit.target: 本示例使用 <tt> 来显示输入到终端应用程序和由终端应用程序输出的文本。

trans-unit.source: This example uses NETWORK and FALLBACK sections to specify that the network.html page must always be retrieved from the network, and that the fallback.html page should be served as a fallback resource (e.g., in case a connection to the server cannot be established).
trans-unit.target: 本示例使用 NETWORK 和 FALLBACK 部分来指定必须始终从网络中检索 network.html 页面，并且 fallback.html 页面应用作后备资源（例如，在无法建立与服务器的连接的情况下） ）。

trans-unit.source: This example uses an image to link to the MDN home page. The home page will open in a new browsing context, that is, a new page or a new tab.
trans-unit.target: 这个例子使用了一个图片来链接到MDN的主页。主页将在一个新的浏览环境中打开,即一个新的页面或新的标签页。

trans-unit.source: This example uses ruby annotations to display the Romaji equivalents for each character.
trans-unit.target: 本示例使用红宝石注释显示每个字符的罗马字等效项。

trans-unit.source: This example uses the <u> element and some CSS to display a paragraph which includes a misspelled error, with the error indicated in the red wavy underline style which is fairly commonly used for this purpose.
trans-unit.target: 此示例使用 <u> 元素和某些CSS来显示包含错误拼写错误的段落，该错误以红色波浪下划线样式指示，该目的通常用于此目的。

trans-unit.source: This example uses the CSS font-size property to increase the font size by one level.
trans-unit.target: 本示例使用CSS font-size 属性将字体大小增加一级。

trans-unit.source: This example uses the obsolete <big> element to increase the size of some text.
trans-unit.target: 本示例使用过时的 <big> 元素来增加某些文本的大小。

trans-unit.source: This excludes these depreciated elements and also forbids such constructs as nesting a header (<H*> element) within a link (<A> element), or having a forms <INPUT> element which is not within a block level element such as <P>
trans-unit.target: 这不包括这些贬值元件和还禁止此类构建体作为嵌套报头（ <H*> 一链路内元件）（ <A> 元件），或具有形式 <INPUT> 元件，其不是块级元素如内 <P>

trans-unit.source: This feature has been removed from the Web standards. Though some browsers may still support it, it is in the process of being dropped. Avoid using it and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

trans-unit.source: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future.
trans-unit.target: 这个功能是非标准的,不在标准轨道上。不要在面向Web的生产站点上使用它:它不会对每个用户都有效。不同的实现之间也可能存在很大的不兼容性,而且未来的行为可能会改变。

trans-unit.source: This form provides a slider whose value can range between 0 and 100. and an <input> element into which you can enter a second number. The two numbers are added together and the result is displayed in the <output> element each time the value of any of the controls changes.
trans-unit.target: 此表单提供了一个滑块，其值的范围可以在0到100之间。还提供了一个 <input> 元素，您可以在其中输入第二个数字。每次任何一个控件的值更改时，这两个数字就会加在一起，并且结果显示在 <output> 元素中。

trans-unit.source: This gets a reference to the color <input> element in a variable called colorWell, then sets the color input's value to the value in defaultColor. Then the color input's input event is set up to call our updateFirst() function, and the change event is set to call updateAll(). These are both seen below.

This gets a reference to the color <input> element in a variable called colorWell, then sets the color input's value to the value in defaultColor. Then the color input's input event is set up to call our updateFirst() function, and the change event is set to call updateAll(). These are both seen below.
trans-unit.target: 这将在名为 colorWell 的变量中获取对color <input> 元素的引用，然后将颜色输入的值设置为 defaultColor 中的值。然后，将颜色输入的 input 事件设置为调用我们的 updateFirst() 函数，并将 change 事件设置为调用 updateAll() 。这些都在下面看到。

trans-unit.source: This gives the same result as the previous example. The first item has two properties, "name", set to "Amanda", and "band", set to another item. That second item has two further properties, "name", set to "Jazz Band", and "size", set to "12".
trans-unit.target: 这样得到的结果和前面的例子一样。第一个项目有两个属性,"名称",设置为 "Amanda","乐队",设置为另一个项目。第二个项目又有两个属性,"名称",设置为 "爵士乐队","大小",设置为 "12"。

trans-unit.source: This helps people navigating with the aid of assistive technology such as a screen reader, people experiencing low vision conditions, and people with cognitive concerns.
trans-unit.target: 这有助于人们借助辅助技术(如屏幕阅读器)、低视力患者和有认知问题的人进行导航。

trans-unit.source: This instruction specifies:
trans-unit.target: 该指令规定:

trans-unit.source: This integer attribute defines, in pixels, the size of the frame surrounding the table. If set to 0, the frame attribute is set to void.
trans-unit.target: 此整数属性以像素为单位定义表格周围框架的大小。如果设置为0，则 frame 属性设置为void。

trans-unit.source: This integer attribute indicates the current ordinal value of the list item as defined by the <ol> element. The only allowed value for this attribute is a number, even if the list is displayed with Roman numerals or letters. List items that follow this one continue numbering from the value set. The value attribute has no meaning for unordered lists (<ul>) or for menus (<menu>).
trans-unit.target: 此整数属性指示由 <ol> 元素定义的列表项的当前顺序值。即使列表以罗马数字或字母显示，此属性唯一允许的值为数字。列表项之后的列表项将从值集中继续编号。所述值属性具有用于无序列表没有意义（ <ul> ）或菜单（ <menu> ）。

trans-unit.source: This integer attribute specifies the start value for numbering the individual list items. Although the ordering type of list elements might be Roman numerals, such as XXXI, or letters, the value of start is always represented as a number. To start numbering elements from the letter "C", use <ol start="3">.
trans-unit.target: 此整数属性指定为各个列表项编号的起始值。尽管列表元素的排序类型可能是罗马数字，例如XXXI或字母，但是start的值始终表示为数字。要从字母“ C”开始编号元素，请使用 <ol start="3"> 。

trans-unit.source: This is a Boolean attribute indicating that the browser should, if possible, load the script asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: 这是一个布尔属性,表示如果可能,浏览器应该异步加载脚本。

trans-unit.source: This is a basic example of an <iframe> in action. After creating the frame, when the user clicks a button, its title is retrieved and displayed in an alert.
trans-unit.target: 这是实际 <iframe> 的基本示例。创建框架后，当用户单击按钮时，将检索其标题并将其显示在警报中。

trans-unit.source: This is a boolean attribute: the presence of a boolean attribute on an element represents the true value, and the absence of the attribute represents the false value.

This is a non-standard attribute supported by WebKit on iOS (therefore nearly all browsers running on iOS, including Safari, Firefox, and Chrome), which controls whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user. The non-deprecated values are available in iOS 5 and later. Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: 这是iOS上WebKit支持的一个非标准属性(因此几乎所有运行在iOS上的浏览器,包括Safari、Firefox和Chrome),它控制文本值在用户输入/编辑时是否以及如何自动大写。在iOS 5及以后的版本中,非大写的值是可用的。可能的值有

trans-unit.source: This is a nonstandard attribute used by iOS Safari Mobile which controls whether and how the text value for textual form control descendants should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user. If the autocapitalize attribute is specified on an individual form control descendant, it trumps the form-wide autocapitalize setting. The non-deprecated values are available in iOS 5 and later. The default value is sentences. Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: 这是iOS Safari Mobile使用的非标准属性，它控制文本形式控件后代的文本值是否以及如何在用户输入/编辑时自动大写。如果在单个表单控件后代中指定了 autocapitalize 属性，则它将 autocapitalize 于整个表单范围的autocapitalize设置。未弃用的值在iOS 5及更高版本中可用。默认值为 sentences 。可能的值为：

trans-unit.source: This is actually one of the common attributes, but it has a special meaning available for hidden inputs. Normally, the name attribute functions on hidden inputs just like on any other input. However, when the form is submitted, a hidden input whose name is set to "_charset_" will automatically be reported with the value set to the character encoding used to submit the form.
trans-unit.target: 这实际上是常见属性之一，但是对于隐藏的输入具有特殊含义。通常， name 属性在隐藏输入上起作用，就像在其他任何输入上一样。但是，提交表单时，将自动报告 name 设置为 "_charset_" 的隐藏输入，其值设置为用于提交表单的字符编码。

trans-unit.source: This is actually one of the common attributes, but it has a special meaning available for hidden inputs. Normally, the name attribute functions on hidden inputs just like on any other input. However, when the form is submitted, a hidden input whose name is set to _charset_ will automatically be reported with the value set to the character encoding used to submit the form.

This is an interesting idea, which goes to show a potential solution to the problem of dealing with international phone numbers. You would have to extend the example of course to provide the correct pattern for potentially every country, which would be a lot of work, and there would still be no foolproof guarantee that the users would enter their numbers correctly.
trans-unit.target: 这是一个有趣的想法,它显示了处理国际电话号码问题的一个潜在解决方案。当然,你必须扩展这个例子,为每个国家提供正确的模式,这将是一个很大的工作,而且仍然不能保证用户会正确输入他们的号码。

trans-unit.source: This is due to inconsistent browser support, compounded by the additional assistive technology parsing of the browser-rendered page. If a tooltip effect is desired, it is better to use a more accessible technique that can be accessed with the above browsing methods.
This is especially helpful for people who are unfamiliar with the terminology or concepts discussed in the content, people who are new to the language, and people with cognitive concerns.
trans-unit.target: 这对那些对内容中讨论的术语或概念不熟悉的人、刚接触语言的人和有认知问题的人特别有帮助。

trans-unit.source: This is especially useful when opening untrusted links, in order to ensure they cannot tamper with the originating document via the Window.opener property (see About rel=noopener for more details), while still providing the Referer HTTP header (unless noreferrer is used as well).
trans-unit.target: 打开不可信链接时，为了确保它们不能经由始发文件篡改这是特别有用 Window.opener 属性（见关于rel = noopener有详细介绍），同时仍提供 Referer HTTP报头（除非 noreferrer 用作好）。

trans-unit.source: This is just some simple code to display the entered SSN onscreen so you can see it. Obviously this defeats the purpose of a password field, but it's helpful for experimenting with the pattern.
trans-unit.target: 这只是一些简单的代码，可以在屏幕上显示输入的SSN，因此您可以看到它。显然，这违背了密码字段的目的，但是对尝试 pattern 很有帮助。

trans-unit.source: This is like regular Level 1 but it also excludes these depreciated elements, along with such constructs as nesting a header (<H*> element) within a link (<A> element)
trans-unit.target: 这就像常规的1级，但它也排除了这些折旧的元素，以及诸如在链接（ <A> 元素）内嵌套标头（ <H*> 元素）之类的构造

trans-unit.source: This is like the level 2 default but it excludes all the forms elements, i. e. <FORM>, <INPUT>, <TEXTAREA>, <SELECT>, and <OPTION>

trans-unit.source: This is mainly due to inconsistent browser support, compounded by the additional complication introduced by assistive technology's parsing of the browser-rendered page. If a tooltip effect is desired, it is better to use a technique that can be accessed with these browsing methods.
trans-unit.target: 这主要是由于对浏览器的支持不一致，以及辅助技术对浏览器呈现的页面的解析所带来的其他复杂性。如果需要工具提示效果，最好使用可以通过这些浏览方法访问的技术。

trans-unit.source: This is most easily demonstrated with a simple example. First, some simple CSS that we'll be using:
trans-unit.target: 这一点用一个简单的例子最容易演示。首先,我们将使用一些简单的CSS。

trans-unit.source: This section lists the attributes which are used by all form <input> types. Attributes that are unique to particular input types—or attributes which are common to all input types but have special behaviors when used on a given input type—are instead documented on those types' pages.
trans-unit.target: 本节列出了所有表单 <input> 类型使用的属性。特定输入类型所独有的属性（或所有输入类型所共有的属性，但在给定输入类型上使用时具有特殊行为）则记录在这些类型的页面上。

trans-unit.source: This section provides a table listing all the attributes with a brief description. This table is followed by a list describing each attribute in greater detail, along with which input types they are associated with.Those that are common to most or all input types are defined in greater detail below. Attributes that are unique to particular input types—or attributes which are common to all input types but have special behaviors when used on a given input type—are instead documented on those types' pages. This element includes the global attributes. Those with extra importance as it relates to <input> are highlighted.

This sets the background color of all <tr> elements in the table's heading (as specified using <thead>). Then we set the bottom border of the top header to be a two-pixel wide line. Notice, however, that we're using the :nth-of-type selector to apply border-bottom to the second row in the heading. Why? Because the heading is made of two rows that are spanned by some of the cells. That means there are actually two rows there; applying the style to the first row would not give us the expected result.
trans-unit.target: 这将设置表标题中所有 <tr> 元素的背景颜色（使用 <thead> 指定）。然后，将顶部标题的底部边框设置为两像素宽的线。但是请注意，我们正在使用 :nth-of-type 选择器将 border-bottom 应用于标题的第二行。为什么？因为标题是由两行组成，这些行由某些单元格跨越。那意味着那里实际上有两排；将样式应用于第一行不会给我们预期的结果。

trans-unit.source: This sets the color of every <p> block so that its color attribute matches the current value of the color input, which is referred to using event.target.
trans-unit.target: 这将设置每个 <p> 块的 color ，以使其颜色属性与颜色输入的当前值匹配，该值使用 event.target 进行引用。

trans-unit.source: This simple CSS just adds a solid black border around the table and around each of its cells, including those specified using both <th> and <td>. That way, both header and data cells are easily demarcated.
trans-unit.target: 这个简单的CSS只是在表格周围及其每个单元格（包括同时使用 <th> 和 <td> 指定的单元格）周围添加了黑色实线边框。这样，标头单元和数据单元都易于划分。

trans-unit.source: This simple example provides the path to the stylesheet inside an href attribute, and a rel attribute with a value of stylesheet. The rel stands for "relationship", and is probably one of the key features of the <link> element — the value denotes how the item being linked to is related to the containing document. As you'll see from our Link types reference, there are many different kinds of relationship.
trans-unit.target: 这个简单的示例在 href 属性中提供了样式表的路径，在 rel 属性中提供了 stylesheet 的值。的 rel 代表“关系”，而可能是的的关键特征中的一个 <link> 元件-该值表示该项目正在如何链接到涉及包含文档。正如您将从我们的链接类型参考中看到的那样，存在许多不同类型的关系。

trans-unit.source: This tag has been deprecated in HTML 4 (and XHTML 1) in favor of the CSStext-align property, which can be applied to the <div> element or to an individual <p>. For centering blocks, use other CSS properties like margin-left and margin-right and set them to auto (or set margin to 0 auto).
trans-unit.target: 此标记已在HTML 4（和XHTML 1）中弃用，以支持CSS text-align 属性，该属性可以应用于 <div> 元素或单个 <p> 。对于居中块，请使用其他CSS属性，例如 margin-left 和 margin-right 并将其设置为 auto （或将 margin 设置为 0 auto ）。

trans-unit.source: This uses a pattern which limits the entered value to strings representing legal Socal Security numbers. Obviously, this regexp doesn't guarantee a valid SSN (since we don't have access to the Social Security Administration's database), but it does ensure the number could be one; it generally avoids values that cannot be valid. In addition, it allows the three groups of digits to be separated by a space, a dash ("-"), or nothing.
trans-unit.target: 这使用一种 pattern ，该模式将输入的值限制为代表合法Socal Security编号的字符串。显然，此正则表达式不能保证有效的SSN（因为我们无权访问社会保障局的数据库），但可以确保数量可以为1。它通常避免使用无效的值。另外，它允许三组数字之间用空格，破折号（“-”）或什么都不分隔。

trans-unit.source: This would stop a malicious user from creating a fake form, pretending to be a bank, and emailing the form to unsuspecting users to trick them into transferring money to the wrong place. This kind of attack is called a Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF); pretty much any reputable server-side framework uses hidden secrets to prevent such attacks.

This would stop a malicious user from creating a fake form, pretending to be a bank, and emailing the form to unsuspecting users to trick them into transferring money to the wrong place. This kind of attack is called a Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF); pretty much any reputable server-side framework uses hidden secrets to prevent such attacks.
trans-unit.target: 这将阻止恶意用户创建伪造的表单，假装自己是银行，然后通过电子邮件将表单发送给毫无戒心的用户，以诱使他们将资金转至错误的位置。这种攻击称为跨站点请求伪造（CSRF）；几乎任何信誉良好的服务器端框架都使用隐藏机密来防止此类攻击。

trans-unit.source: This wraps the entire key sequence in an outer <kbd> element, then each individual key within its own, in order to denote the components of the sequence.
trans-unit.target: 这将整个密钥序列包装在一个外部 <kbd> 元素中，然后将每个单独的密钥包装在自己的内部，以表示该序列的组成部分。

trans-unit.source: This, the default value, sends the form data as a string after URL encoding the text using an algorithm such as encodeURI().
trans-unit.target: 这是默认值，在使用诸如 encodeURI() 之类的算法对文本进行URL编码之后，将表单数据作为字符串发送给字符串。

trans-unit.source: Though the purpose of this tag is purely for the convenience of the author, its default styling varies from one browser to another:
trans-unit.target: 虽然这个标签的目的纯粹是为了方便作者,但它的默认样式因浏览器而异。

trans-unit.source: Though the same visual effect can be achieved using the CSS rule unicode-bidi: isolate on a <span> or another text-formatting element, HTML authors should not use this approach because it is not semantic and browsers are allowed to ignore CSS styling.
trans-unit.target: 尽管可以使用CSS规则 unicode-bidi : isolate 在 <span> 或其他文本格式元素上实现相同的视觉效果，但HTML作者不应使用此方法，因为它不是语义，并且允许浏览器忽略CSS样式。

trans-unit.source: Though the specification doesn't put requirements on the name of classes, web developers are encouraged to use names that describe the semantic purpose of the element, rather than the presentation of the element. For example, attribute to describe an attribute rather than italics, although an element of this class may be presented by italics. Semantic names remain logical even if the presentation of the page changes.
trans-unit.target: 尽管规范没有对类的名称提出要求，但鼓励Web开发人员使用描述元素语义目的的名称，而不是元素的表示形式。例如，属性用于描述属性而不是斜体，尽管此类的元素可以用斜体表示。即使页面的显示发生变化，语义名称仍保持逻辑。

trans-unit.source: Though unstandardized, this declaration is respected by most mobile browsers due to de-facto dominance.
trans-unit.target: 虽然不规范,但由于事实上的主导地位,这个声明被大多数移动浏览器所尊重。

To achieve a similar effect for dynamically inserted scripts use async=false instead. Scripts with the defer attribute will execute in the order in which they appear in the document.
trans-unit.target: 要对动态插入的脚本实现类似的效果，请改用 async=false 。具有 defer 属性的脚本将按照它们在文档中出现的顺序执行。

trans-unit.source: To achieve a similar effect, apply the border property to the appropriate <thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>, <col>, or <colgroup> elements.
To achieve a similar effect, apply the border-collapse property to the <table> element, with its value set to collapse, and the padding property to the <td> elements.
To achieve a similar effect, apply the border-spacing property to the <table> element. border-spacing does not have any effect if border-collapse is set to collapse.
To achieve a similar effect, use the border-style and border-width properties.
To achieve a similar effect, use the CSS background-color property.

trans-unit.source: Traditionally in browsers the HTML parser has run on the main thread and is blocked after a </script> tag until the script has been retrieved from the network and executed. The HTML parser in Firefox 4 and later supports speculative parsing off of the main thread. It parses ahead while scripts are being downloaded and executed. As in Firefox 3.5 and 3.6, the HTML parser starts speculative loads for scripts, style sheets and images it finds ahead in the stream. However, in Firefox 4 and later the HTML parser also runs the HTML tree construction algorithm speculatively. The upside is that when a speculation succeeds, there's no need to reparse the part of the incoming file that was already scanned for scripts, style sheets and images. The downside is that there's more work lost when the speculation fails.
trans-unit.target: 传统上，在浏览器中，HTML解析器运行在主线程上，并在 </script> 标记后被阻止，直到从网络中检索并执行脚本为止。 Firefox 4和更高版本中的HTML解析器支持对主线程的推测性解析。它在下载和执行脚本时先解析。与Firefox 3.5和3.6一样，HTML解析器开始对脚本，样式表和在流中找到的图像进行推测性加载。但是，在Firefox 4和更高版本中，HTML解析器也以推测方式运行HTML树构造算法。好处是，当推测成功时，无需重新解析已扫描的脚本，样式表和图像的传入文件部分。不利的一面是，当投机失败时，将会有更多的工作丢失。

trans-unit.source: Typically this element is displayed in italic type. However, it should not be used simply to apply italic styling; use the CSS font-style property for that purpose. Use the <cite> element to mark the title of a work (book, play, song, etc.). Use the <i> element to mark text that is in an alternate tone or mood, which covers many common situations for italics such as scientific names or words in other languages. Use the <strong> element to mark text that has greater importance than surrounding text.
trans-unit.target: 通常，此元素以斜体显示。但是，不应仅将其用于斜体样式。为此使用CSS font-style 属性。使用 <cite> 元素标记作品的标题（书籍，戏剧，歌曲等）。使用 <i> 元素标记具有替代音调或语气的文本，其中包括斜体字的许多常见情况，例如科学名称或其他语言的单词。使用 <strong> 元素标记比周围的文本更重要的文本。

trans-unit.source: Typically this element is rendered by default using a bold font weight. However, it should not be used simply to apply bold styling; use the CSS font-weight property for that purpose. Use the <b> element to draw attention to certain text without indicating a higher level of importance. Use the <em> element to mark text that has stress emphasis.
trans-unit.target: 通常，默认情况下使用粗体字体粗细呈现此元素。但是，应该不是简单地用来申请大胆的造型; 为此使用CSS font-weight 属性。使用 <b> 元素来吸引对某些文本的注意，而不表示更高的重要性。使用 <em> 元素标记强调重点的文本。

trans-unit.source: Typically, browsers style the contents of a <cite> element in italics by default. To avoid this, apply the CSS font-style property to the <cite> element.
trans-unit.target: 通常，浏览器默认情况下以斜体样式设置 <cite> 元素的内容。为避免这种情况，请将CSS font-style 属性应用于 <cite> 元素。

trans-unit.source: Typically, ordered list items display with a preceding marker, such as a number or letter.

Typically, ordered-list items are displayed with a preceding numbering, which can be of any form, like numerals, letters or Romans numerals or even simple bullets. This numbered style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
trans-unit.target: 通常，列表中的项目以前面的编号显示，该编号可以是任何形式，例如数字，字母或罗马数字，甚至是简单的项目符号。该编号样式未在页面的HTML描述中定义，而是在其关联的CSS中使用 list-style-type 属性定义。

trans-unit.source: Unlike many data types, time values have a periodic domain, meaning that the values reach the highest possible value, then wrap back around to the beginning again. For example, specifying a min of "14:00" and a max of "2:00" means that the permitted time values start at 2:00 PM, run through midnight to the next day, ending at 2:00 AM.
trans-unit.target: 与许多数据类型不同，时间值具有周期性域，这意味着值达到最大可能值，然后重新回到起始位置。例如，指定一 min 的 "14:00" 和一个 max 的 "2:00" 的装置将允许的时间值在2:00 PM，通过午夜运行到第二天开始，在上午02点结束。

trans-unit.source: Unlike many data types, time values have a periodic domain, meaning that the values reach the highest possible value, then wrap back around to the beginning again. For example, specifying a min of 14:00 and a max of 2:00 means that the permitted time values start at 2:00 PM, run through midnight to the next day, ending at 2:00 AM. See more in the making min and max cross midnight section of this article.

Use careful consideration for accessibility when applying the autofocus attribute. Automatically focusing on a control can cause the page to scroll on load. The focus can also cause dynamic keyboards to display on some touch devices. While a screen reader will announce the label of the form control receiving focus, the screen reader will not announce anything before the label, and the sighted user on a small device will equally miss the context created by the preceding content.

Use the title attribute on an embed element to label its content so that people navigating with assistive technology such as a screen reader can understand what it contains. The title's value should concisely describe the embedded content. Without a title, they may not be able to determine what its embedded content is. This context shift can be confusing and time-consuming, especially if the embed element contains interactive content like video or audio.

trans-unit.source: Valid for date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, and range, it defines the greatest value in the range of permitted values. If the value entered into the element exceeds this, the element fails constraint validation. If the value of the max attribute isn't a number, then the element has no maximum value.

Valid for date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, and range, it defines the most negative value in the range of permitted values. If the value entered into the element is less than this this, the element fails constraint validation. If the value of the min attribute isn't a number, then the element has no minimum value.

Valid for email, password, tel, and textinput types only. Specifies how much of the input is shown. Basically creates same result as setting CSS width property with a few specialities. The actual unit of the value depends on the input type. For password and text, it is a number of characters (or em units) with a default value of 20, and for others, it is pixels. CSS width takes precedence over size attribute.

Valid for text and search input types only, the dirname attribute enables the submission of the directionality of the element. When included, the form control will submit with two name/value pairs: the first being the name and value, the second being the value of the dirname as the name with the value of ltr or rtl being set by the browser.

Valid for text, search, url, tel, email, and password, it defines the maximum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into the field. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no maxlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the field has no maximum length. This value must also be greater than or equal to the value of minlength.

Valid for text, search, url, tel, email, and password, it defines the minimum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into the entry field. This must be an non-negative integer value smaller than or equal to the value specified by maxlength. If no minlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no minimum length.

Valid for both radio and checkbox types, checked is a Boolean attribute. If present on a radio type, it indicates that that radio button is the currently selected one in the group of same-named radio buttons. If present on a checkbox type, it indicates that the checkbox is checked by default (when the page loads). It does not indicate whether this checkbox is currently checked: if the checkbox’s state is changed, this content attribute does not reflect the change. (Only the HTMLInputElement’s checked IDL attribute is updated.)
Valid for the file input type only, the accept attribute defines which file types are selectable in a file upload control. See the file input type.
Valid for the image and submit input types only. See the submit input type for more information.

Valid for the image button only, the alt attribute provides alternative text for the image, displaying the value of the attribute if the image src is missing or otherwise fails to load. See the image input type.
Valid for the image input button only, the height is the height of the image file to display to represent the graphical submit button. See the image input type.
Valid for the image input button only, the src is string specifying the URL of the image file to display to represent the graphical submit button. See the image input type.
Valid for the image input button only, the width is the width of the image file to display to represent the graphical submit button. See the image input type.
Valid for the numeric input types, including number, date/time input types, and range, the step attribute is a number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.
Valid use cases for the <u> element include annotating spelling errors, applying a proper name mark to denote proper names in Chinese text, and other forms of annotation.

trans-unit.source: Video example

Videos should provide both captions and transcripts that accurately describe its content (see Adding captions and subtitles to HTML5 video for more information on how to implement these). Captions allow people who are experiencing hearing loss to understand a video's audio content as the video is being played, while transcripts allow people who need additional time to be able to review audio content at a pace and format that is comfortable for them.
trans-unit.target: 视频应提供标题和字幕，以准确描述其内容（有关如何实现这些内容的更多信息，请参阅向HTML5视频添加标题和字幕）。字幕可让正在听力受损的人在播放视频时了解其音频内容，而笔录可让需要更多时间的人能够以适合他们的速度和格式查看音频内容。

trans-unit.source: Videos should provide both captions and transcripts that accurately describe its content (see Adding captions and subtitles to HTML5 video for more information on how to implement these). trans-unit.source: We include media attributes on our <link> elements so that a narrow image is preloaded if the user has a narrow viewport, and a wider image is loaded if they have a wide viewport. We use Window.matchMedia / MediaQueryList to do this (see Testing media queries for more).
We keep the orient attribute with a value of vertical for Firefox:

We now see a monochromatic palette based on the color we picked from the Mars photo. If you need a lot of related colors for some reason, those are likely to be good ones. But what we really want is an accent color. Something that will pop along side the base color. To find that, we click the "add complementary" toggle underneath the menu that lets you select the palette type (currently "Monochromatic"). Paletton computes an appropriate accent color; clicking on the accent color down in the bottom-right corner tells us that this color is #508D7C.
trans-unit.target: 现在，我们会根据从火星照片中选取的颜色看到一个单色调色板。如果出于某种原因需要大量相关颜色，则这些颜色可能是不错的选择。但是我们真正想要的是一种强调色。某些东西会沿着基本颜色弹出。为此，我们单击菜单下方的“添加补充”开关，该开关可让您选择调色板类型（当前为“单色”）。 Paletton计算适当的强调色；单击右下角的重点颜色可以告诉我们该颜色是 #508D7C 。

trans-unit.source: We offer a substantive and thorough guide to media file types and the audio codecs that can be used within them. Also available is a guide to the codecs supported for video.
We offer a substantive and thorough guide to media file types and the guide to the codecs supported for video. Also available is a guide to audio codecs that can be used with them.

We provide two functions that deal with color changes. The updateFirst() function is called in response to the input event. It changes the color of the first paragraph element in the document to match the new value of the color input. Since input events are fired every time an adjustment is made to the value (for example, if the brightness of the color is increased), these will happen repeatedly as the color picker is used.
trans-unit.target: 我们提供了两个处理颜色变化的功能。所述 updateFirst() 函数被调用响应于所述 input 事件。它将更改文档中第一段元素的颜色，以匹配颜色输入的新值。由于每次对值进行调整时都会触发 input 事件（例如，如果增加颜色的亮度），则在使用颜色选择器时将重复发生这些事件。

We'll also take a look at how to let the user pick a color.

trans-unit.source: We're using a hard-coded URL here (imageURL), but that could easily come from anywhere. To begin downloading the image, we create a new HTMLImageElement object by using the Image() constructor. The image is then configured to allow cross-origin downloading by setting its crossOrigin attribute to "Anonymous" (that is, allow non-authenticated downloading of the image cross-origin). An event listener is added for the load event being fired on the image element, which means the image data has been received.
trans-unit.target: 我们在这里使用的是硬编码的URL（ imageURL ），但这很容易来自任何地方。要开始下载图像，我们使用 Image() 构造函数创建一个新的 HTMLImageElement 对象。然后，通过将图像的 crossOrigin 属性设置为 "Anonymous" （即，允许对图像进行跨域的未经身份验证的下载），将图像配置为允许跨域下载。为在图像元素上触发的 load 事件添加了事件侦听器，这意味着已接收到图像数据。

trans-unit.source: We've already covered the fact that by default, the increment is 1, and you can use the step attribute to allow decimal inputs. Let's take a closer look. The input for the height in meters accepts decimals to two places.
trans-unit.target: 我们已经介绍了默认情况下增量为1的事实，您可以使用 step 属性允许十进制输入。让我们仔细看看。在以下示例中，我们设置了一个用于输入用户身高的表格；它默认接受以米为单位的高度，但是您可以单击相关按钮以将表格更改为接受英尺和英寸。以米为单位的高度输入接受小数点后两位。

trans-unit.source: What looks good on screen may look very different on paper. In addition, ink can be expensive, and if a user is printing your page, they don't necessarily need all the backgrounds and such using up their precious ink when all that matters is the text itself. Most browsers, by default, remove background images when printing documents.
trans-unit.target: 在屏幕上看起来很好的东西在纸上可能看起来非常不同。此外,墨水是很昂贵的,如果用户正在打印你的页面,当所有重要的是文本本身时,他们不一定需要所有的背景等耗费他们宝贵的墨水。大多数浏览器,默认情况下,在打印文档时都会删除背景图片。

trans-unit.source: When Mozilla introduced dedicated content threads to Firefox (through the Electrolysis, or e10s, project), support for styling <option> elements was removed temporarily. Starting in Firefox 54, you can apply foreground and background colors to <option> elements again, using the color and background-color CSS properties. See bug 910022 for more information. Note that this is still disabled in Linux due to lack of contrast (see bug 1338283 for progress on this).
trans-unit.target: 当Mozilla（通过Electrolysis或e10s项目）向Firefox引入专用的内容线程时，暂时取消了对 <option> 元素样式的支持。从Firefox 54开始，您可以使用 color 和 background-color CSS属性将前景色和背景色再次应用于 <option> 元素。有关更多信息，请参见错误910022。请注意，由于缺乏对比，在Linux中仍然禁用此功能（有关此方面的进展，请参见错误1338283）。

trans-unit.source: When a <label> is clicked or tapped and it is associated with a form control, the resulting click event is also raised for the associated control.
trans-unit.target: 当单击 <label> 或将其与窗体控件关联时，也会为关联的控件引发 click 事件。

trans-unit.source: When a file is chosen using an <input type="file">, the real path to the source file is not shown in the input's value attribute for obvious security reasons. Instead, the filename is shown, with C:\fakepath\ appended to the beginning of it. There are some historical reasons for this quirk, but it is supported across all modern browsers, and in fact is defined in the spec.
trans-unit.target: 当使用 <input type="file"> 选择文件时，出于明显的安全原因，在输入的 value 属性中未显示源文件的实际路径。而是显示文件名，并在文件名的开头附加 C:\fakepath\ 。造成这种奇怪的现象有一些历史原因，但所有现代浏览器均支持该异常，并且实际上是在规范中进行了定义。

trans-unit.source: When a form including a time input is submitted, the value is encoded before being included in the form's data. The form's data entry for a time input will always be in the form "name=hh%3Amm", or "name=hh%3Amm%3ass" if seconds are included (see Using the step attribute).
trans-unit.target: 提交包含 time 输入的表单时，值会先编码，然后再包含在表单数据中。输入时间的表单数据输入将始终为 "name=hh%3Amm" 或 "name=hh%3Amm%3ass" 如果包括秒在内）（请参阅使用step属性）。

trans-unit.source: When a form including a time input is submitted, the value is encoded before being included in the form's data. The form's data entry for a time input will always be in the form name=hh%3Amm, or name=hh%3Amm%3ass if seconds are included (see Using the step attribute).

When a parser encounters this data, it will know that this page contains a "card" which describes a person or organization named Alice Blogger with a URL of http://alice.example.com/. The parser makes this data available via APIs that can be used for different applications.

When a string value can't be easily read and understood by a person (e.g., a long string of numbers and letters), it can be displayed using the value attribute of the data element, with the more easily-understood-by-a human-version given in the element's contents (which is not part of the structured data - see example below).
trans-unit.target: 当一个字符串值不容易被人阅读和理解时(例如,一串长长的数字和字母),可以使用数据元素的value属性来显示,并在元素的内容中给出更容易被人理解的版本(这不是结构化数据的一部分--见下面的例子)。

trans-unit.source: When a table is presented in a screen context (such as a window) which is not large enough to display the entire table, the user agent may let the user scroll the contents of the <thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>, and <caption> blocks separately from one another for the same parent table.
trans-unit.target: 当在屏幕上下文（例如窗口）中显示表格时，该表格的大小不足以显示整个表格，则用户代理可以让用户滚动 <thead> ， <tbody> ， <tfoot> ，和 <caption> 块对于同一父表彼此分开。

trans-unit.source: When an <article> element is nested, the inner element represents an article related to the outer element. For example, the comments of a blog post can be <article> elements nested in the <article> representing the blog post.
trans-unit.target: 当 <article> 元素嵌套，内部元件表示与外部元件的制品。例如，博客文章的评论可以是 <article> 元素，嵌套在 <article> 中,代表博客文章。

trans-unit.source: When an alt attribute is not present on an image, some screen readers may announce the image's file name instead. This can be a confusing experience if the file name isn't representative of the image's contents.
trans-unit.target: 当图像上不存在 alt 属性时，某些屏幕阅读器可能会宣布图像的文件名。如果文件名不代表图像内容，这可能会造成混乱。

trans-unit.source: When an abbreviation is used and you want to provide an expansion or definition outside the flow of the document's content, use <abbr> with an appropriate title.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用缩写，并且您想在文档内容流之外提供扩展名或定义，请使用带有适当 title <abbr> 。

trans-unit.source: When an abbreviation's presence in the text needs to be semantically noted, the <abbr> element is useful. This can be used, in turn, for styling or scripting purposes.
trans-unit.target: 当需要在语义上 <abbr> 缩写词的出现时，<abbr>元素很有用。依次将其用于样式或脚本编写目的。

trans-unit.source: When an input has the required attribute, the :required pseudo-class also applies to it. Conversely, inputs without the required attribute (except the elements that don't support it) have the :optional pseudo-class applied.
trans-unit.target: 当输入具有 required 属性时， :required 伪类也适用于该属性。相反，没有 required 属性（不支持该属性的元素除外）的输入将应用 :optional 伪类。

trans-unit.source: When applications are cached, simply updating the resources (files) that are used in a web page is not enough to update the files that have been cached. You must update the cache manifest file itself before the browser retrieves and uses the updated files. You can do this programmatically using window.applicationCache.swapCache(), though resources that have already been loaded will not be affected. To make sure that resources are loaded from a new version of the application cache, refreshing the page is ideal.
trans-unit.target: 缓存应用程序时，仅更新网页中使用的资源（文件）不足以更新已缓存的文件。在浏览器检索和使用更新的文件之前，必须先更新缓存清单文件本身。您可以使用 window.applicationCache.swapCache() 以编程方式执行此操作，尽管已加载的资源不会受到影响。为了确保从新版本的应用程序缓存中加载资源，刷新页面是理想的选择。

trans-unit.source: When designing your palette, be sure to keep in mind that in addition to the colors these tools typically generate, you'll probably also need to add some core neutral colors such as white (or nearly white), black (or nearly black), and some number of shades of gray.
trans-unit.target: 在设计你的调色板时,一定要记住,除了这些工具通常生成的颜色外,你可能还需要添加一些核心的中性色,如白色(或接近白色)、黑色(或接近黑色)和一些灰色的色调。

trans-unit.source: When headings are nested, heading levels may be "skipped" when closing a subsection.
trans-unit.target: 当标题被嵌套时,在关闭一个小节时,标题层次可以被 "跳过"。

trans-unit.source: When including inputs, it is an accessibilty requirement to add labels along side. This is needed so those who use assistive technologies can tell what the input is for. Also, clicking or touching a label gives focus to the label's associated form control. This improves the accessibility and usability for sighted users, increases the area a user can click or touch to activate the form control. this is especially useful (and even needed) for radio buttons and checkboxes, which are tiny. For more information about labels in general see Labels .

When including inputs, it is recommended to add labels along side. This is so those who use assistive technologies can tell what the input is for. For more information about labels in general see Labels and placeholders .
trans-unit.target: 包括输入时，建议在旁边添加标签。这样，那些使用辅助技术的人就可以分辨输入的内容。有关一般标签的更多信息，请参见标签和占位符。

trans-unit.source: When not present, the resource is fetched without a CORS request (i.e. without sending the Origin: HTTP header), preventing its non-tainted used in <canvas> elements. If invalid, it is handled as if the enumerated keyword anonymous was used. See CORS settings attributes for additional information.
trans-unit.target: 如果不存在，则在没有CORS请求的情况下（即，不发送 Origin: HTTP标头）获取资源，以防止在 <canvas> 元素中使用未污染的资源。如果无效，则将其当作使用枚举关键字 anonymous 进行处理。有关其他信息，请参见CORS设置属性。

trans-unit.source: When not present, the resource is fetched without a CORS request (i.e. without sending the Origin: HTTP header), preventing its non-tainted used in <canvas> elements. If invalid, it is handled as if the enumerated keyword anonymous was used. See CORS settings attributes for additional information.
trans-unit.target: 如果不存在，则在没有CORS请求的情况下（即，不发送 Origin: HTTP标头）获取资源，以防止在 <canvas> 元素中使用未污染的资源。如果无效，则将其当作使用枚举关键字匿名的方式进行处理。有关其他信息，请参见CORS设置属性。

trans-unit.source: When preloading resources that are fetched with CORS enabled (e.g. fetch(), XMLHttpRequest or fonts), special care needs to be taken to setting the crossorigin attribute on your <link> element. The attribute needs to be set to match the resource's CORS and credentials mode, event when the fetch is not cross-origin.

When printing a document, the <thead> and <tfoot> elements specify information that may be the same—or at least very similar—on every page of a multi-page table, while the <tbody> element's contents generally will differ from page to page.

When printing a document, the <thead> and <tfoot> elements specify information that may be the same—or at least very similar—on every page of a multi-page table, while the <tbody> element's contents generally will differ from page to page.
trans-unit.target: 打印文档时， <thead> 和 <tfoot> 元素指定的信息在多页表的每一页上可能相同或至少非常相似，而 <tbody> 元素的内容通常与页面不同到页面。

trans-unit.source: When scripting is disabled and when it is a descendant of the <head> element: in any order, zero or more <link> elements, zero or more <style> elements, and zero or more <meta> elements.
trans-unit.target: 禁用脚本并成为 <head> 元素的后代时：以任何顺序，零个或多个 <link> 元素，零个或多个 <style> 元素以及零个或多个 <meta> 元素。

trans-unit.source: When scripting is disabled and when it isn't a descendant of the <head> element: any transparent content, but no <noscript> element must be among its descendants.
When scripting is disabled and when it isn't a descendant of the <head> element: any transparent content, but no <noscript> element must be among its descendants.
trans-unit.target: 当脚本被禁用并且不是 <head> 元素的后代时：任何透明内容，但任何 <noscript> 元素都不得在其后代中。

trans-unit.source: When tabbing into a series of same-named group of radio buttons, if one is checked, that one will receive focus. If they aren't grouped together in source order, if one of the group is checked, tabbing into the group starts when the first one in the group is encountered, skipping all those that aren't checked. In other words, if one is checked, tabbing skips the unchecked radio buttons in the group. If none are checked, the radio button group receives focus when the first button in the same name group is reached.

trans-unit.source: When trying to decide upon a base color, you may find that browser extensions that let you select colors from web content can be particularly handy. Some of these are even specifically designed to help with this sort of work. For example, the web site ColorZilla offers an extension (Chrome / Firefox) that offers an eyedropper tool for picking colors from the web. It can also take averages of the colors of pixels in various sized areas or even a selected area of the page.
trans-unit.target: 尝试确定基本颜色时，您可能会发现浏览器扩展使您可以从Web内容中选择颜色特别方便。其中一些甚至是专门设计用于帮助此类工作的。例如，网站ColorZilla提供了一个扩展程序（Chrome / Firefox），该扩展程序提供了一个吸管工具，用于从Web上选择颜色。它还可以取各种尺寸区域甚至页面选定区域中像素颜色的平均值。

trans-unit.source: When trying to decide upon a base color, you may find that browser extensions that let you select colors from web content can be particularly handy. Some of these are even specifically designed to help with this sort of work. For example, the website ColorZilla offers an extension (Chrome / Firefox) that offers an eyedropper tool for picking colors from the web. It can also take averages of the colors of pixels in various sized areas or even a selected area of the page.

When used in a quotation (<q>) or block quote (<blockquote>), it generally indicates text which is of special interest but is not marked in the original source material, or material which needs special scrutiny even though the original author didn't think it was of particular importance. Think of this like using a highlighter pen in a book to mark passages that you find of interest.
trans-unit.target: 当用引号（ <q> ）或块引用（ <blockquote> ）时，它通常表示具有特殊意义但未在原始源材料中标记的文本，或即使原始作者没有特殊注释也需要特别检查的文本认为这不是特别重要。可以将其想象为在书中使用荧光笔标记您感兴趣的段落。

When using <link> to establish a favicon for a site, and your site uses a Content Security Policy (CSP) to enhance its security, the policy applies to the favicon. If you encounter problems with the favicon not loading, verify that the Content-Security-Policy header's img-src directive is not preventing access to it.
trans-unit.target: 当使用 <link> 为站点建立图标时，并且您的站点使用内容安全策略（CSP）增强其安全性时，该策略将应用于该图标。如果您在无法加载收藏图标时遇到问题，请验证 Content-Security-Policy 标头的 img-src 指令是否阻止对其进行访问。

trans-unit.source: When writing a chemical formula, such as H<sub>2</sub>0, the number of atoms of a given element within the described molecule is represented using a subscripted number; in the case of water, the subscripted "2" indicates that there are two atoms of hydrogen in the molecule.
trans-unit.target: 在编写化学式（例如H <sub>2</sub> 0）时，所描述分子内给定元素的原子数用下标数字表示；在水的情况下，下标“ 2”表示分子中有两个氢原子。

trans-unit.source: When you click on the image to submit the form, you'll see the data appended to the URL as parameters, for example "?x=52&y=55". If the image input has a name attribute, then keep in mind that the specified name is prefixed on every attribute, so if the name is "position", then the returned coordinates would be formatted in the URL as "?position.x=52&position.y=55". This, of course, applies to all other attributes as well.
trans-unit.target: 单击图像提交表单时，您将看到作为参数附加到URL的数据，例如 "?x=52&y=55" 。如果图像输入具有 name 属性，请记住，每个属性都以指定的名称为前缀，因此，如果 name 为 "position" ，则返回的坐标将在URL中格式化为 "?position.x=52&position.y=55" 。当然，这也适用于所有其他属性。

trans-unit.source: When you click on the image to submit the form, you'll see the data appended to the URL as parameters, for example ?x=52&y=55. This, of course, applies to all other attributes as well.

When you create a URL input with the proper type value, url, you get automatic validation that the entered text is at least in the correct form to potentially be a legitimate URL. This can help avoid cases in which the user mis-types their web site's address, or provides an invalid one.

trans-unit.source: When you specify the itemscope attribute for an element, a new item is created. The item consists of a group of name-value pairs. For elements with an itemscope attribute and an itemtype attribute, you may also specify an id attribute. You can use the id attribute to set a global identifier for the new item. A global identifier allows the item to relate to other items found on pages across the Web.
trans-unit.target: 当您为元素指定 itemscope 属性时，将创建一个新项目。该项目由一组名称/值对组成。对于具有 itemscope 属性和 itemtype 属性的元素，您还可以指定 id 属性。您可以使用 id 属性为新商品设置全局标识符。全局标识符允许该项目与在Web页面上找到的其他项目相关。

trans-unit.source: While <em> is used to change the meaning of a sentence as spoken emphasis does ("I love carrots" vs. "I love carrots"), <strong> is used to give portions of a sentence added importance (e.g., "Warning! This is very dangerous.") Both <strong> and <em> can be nested to increase the relative degree of importance or stress emphasis, respectively.
